ost_step.2: To find the image of $\begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix}$, we reflect it across the origin, because the line of reflection passes through the origin.
ost_step.3: Reflecting a point across the origin changes both components of the point to their negatives.
ost_step.4: Therefore, the image of $\begin{pmatrix} -2 \\ 3 \end{pmatrix}$ under this reflection is $\begin{pmatrix} -\left(-2\right) \\ -\left(3\right) \end{pmatrix}=\begin{pmatrix} 2 \\ -3 \end{pmatrix}$.
